topic.title: Bootstrap Pins

note.p: Bootstrap pins can be used as functional GPIOs or other modes after the switch has booted. The pins only need to retain these values during FW boot. After this point, these pins can be used for other purposes.
1b: Quad SPI mode (Only quad mode is currently supported)
For correct device operation, configure the pins as follows:

p.b: Original Control (Switchtec always does a SPI reset)

note.p: 1b: Enables executing soft reset sequence to bring flash to default state once SPI controller comes out of reset

entry.p: 0b: For correct device operation, but provide an option to connect a pull-up for future use-cases.

note.p: 1b: Enables executing XIP exit sequence once SPI controller comes out of reset

entry.p: 1b: For correct device operation, but provide an option to connect a pull-down for future use-cases.
1b: For correct device operation, but provide an option to connect a pull-down for future use-cases.

note.p: 0: The value is ECO LBI OEB

entry.p: 0b: For correct device operation, but provide an option to connect a pull-up for future use-cases.
This bootstrap controls the second bit of the lower 2 bits of the TWI address used for BL1 disaster recovery. The remaining bits are programmed in the onetime-programmable memory registers.
The default Boot Recovery TWI address is 0x58 if these bits are set to 00b and the one-time-programmable (OTP) register is left at default.
This bootstrap controls the first bit of the lower 2 bits of the TWI address used for BL1 disaster recovery. The remaining bits are programmed in the onetime-programmable memory registers.
The default Boot Recovery TWI address is 0x58 if these bits are set to 00b and the one-time-programmable (OTP) register is left at default.

li.p: Refer to GPIO Multiplexing for details on configuring the switch to support this interface.
